description:
The app now works fine when screen mirroring, but when extending (by selecting "virtual display") the resolution is fixed at 1280x720 and it is not possible to change it.

Note: I use the Microsoft wireless display adapter.
summary: Works fine when mirroring, but resolution is too low when extending

description:
It does what is says it does. While it doesn't work for everything (e.g. devices that require PINs don't work), it works most of the time and when it does, it works very well.

I especially like that you can create a virtual monitor and cast *that*, instead of simply mirroring your main screen. This is a functionality that most screencasting apps don't offer, and is very nice to see.

One big caveat is the design - it's a relic of the early GNOME 3 era, and could definetely use some porting to GTK4/Adwaita. Other than that, it's great.
summary: Works most of the time, but needs some modernisation

description: It worked out of the box. I had some small issues related to latency (the shared screen was 1-2 seconds behind what I was currently showing) and to the audio not being mirrored, but other than that it worked flawlessly and the connection seemed to be stable.
summary: It worked out of the box

description:
This used to crash my WiFi driver, but after the update to Fedora 33 Screen Share is now working. This is a really nice feature, to be able to show a presentation on the television. 
It would be awesome if the delay could be minimized a bit in a further version
summary: Finally works after the upgrade to Fedora 33

description:
Tested it on Kubuntu 21.04 and it works (with LG TV), but:
The performance is really bad, the network is barely used, as the system monitor reports, less than 100 KB/s
Switched wpa_supplicant to iwd for better wifi performance and features and the program dosn't work at all anymore saying that it cannot find any Wifi adapters even though the internet still works and I'm writing this review over that wifi.
The naming is weird having Gnome in it, even though I'm on KDE and it makes the icon name longer than what it should be.
I don't like that it doesn't respect my custom window decorations and it still displays the Gnome ones
summary: Still needs a lot of work !

description:
This app lets me connect to my Microsoft Wireless Display Adapter. Sometimes it fails, but I keep retrying connection and it worked. Would be better if it can show error details without the need to run G_MESSAGES_DEBUG=all in terminal.

I'm using this app with wpa_supplicant and ath10k driver.
summary: Works great most of the time, But error messages need improvements

description: Please dont update to p2p connection. I downloaded from github the latest one, it asked me to p2p connection. So please ..
summary: Best Miracast for linux

description: This app lets me easily select a display from my dual-monitor setup and cast to my Miracast-equipped TV without going though complicated steps. Can be even better/more convenient if the app can switch the audio output device automatically on connecting to/disconnecting from displays without user having to switch manually.
summary: Great for casting to Miracast-powered TV dongle
